message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SD, cs.AI 

This paper deals with learning representations for spoken utterances, which is a problem in natural language processing (NLP) and speech processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses recent advances in multimodal learning, which involves processing multiple sources of information, such as facial expressions and body gestures, and building complex models using attention, memory, and recurrent components. This suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to building and evaluating machine learning models. Additionally, the paper mentions using linear transformations to model unimodal factors, which is a common technique in computer vision (CV) and image processing. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is another likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the efficiency of the proposed models during learning and inference, which could be relevant to cs.SD (Software Engineering) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), both of which cover topics related to building efficient and scalable software systems.
